definition:
Let $X$ and $Q$ be modules. We say that $Q$ is an [*injective hull*]{}
or [*injective envelope*]{} of $X$ if $Q$ is both an injective module
and an essential extension of $X$.

Equivalently, $Q$ is an injective hull of $X$ if $Q$ is injective, and
$X$ is a submodule of $Q$, and if $g : X \to Q'$ is a monomorphism from
$X$ to an injective module $Q'$, then there exists a monomorphism
$h : Q \to Q'$ such that $h(x) = g(x)$ for all $x \in X$. $$\xymatrix{
  &
  0
        \ar[d]
  \\
  0
        \ar[r]
  &
  X
        \ar[r]^i
        \ar[d]_g
  &
  Q
        \ar@{-->}[dl]^h
  \\
  &
  Q'
}$$

Every module $X$ has an injective hull, which is unique up to
isomorphism. The injective hull of $X$ is sometimes denoted $E(X)$.
